topic: johnson & johnson strikes deal with u.s. government to lower drug prices

text: A major pharmaceutical company has made a significant deal with the US government to lower medication prices.
The agreement will affect several popular prescription drugs used to treat various health conditions.
The goal of the deal is to increase access to affordable healthcare for millions of people.

identity_keyword: US Department of Health and Human Services
text: The deal is the result of months of negotiations between the company and the US government.
The price reductions will apply to patients with different types of insurance.
The exact details of the pricing structure have not been fully disclosed.
Patient advocacy groups and healthcare professionals have welcomed the news.
Many questions still remain about the long-term implications of the deal.
The deal may affect the company's bottom line in the long run.
Other pharmaceutical companies may follow suit in the future.
The true impact of the agreement may not be fully understood for several years.
Analysts are still trying to understand the implications of the deal.
The deal has sent shockwaves through the healthcare industry.
The future of drug pricing is uncertain.
